summary: The "Space Research Innovation Act" (H.R. 108) directs the NASA Administrator to establish a new university-affiliated research center. This center will support NASA's deep-space and interplanetary research missions by funding analyses and engineering support. It is required to have expertise in forging academic and private sector partnerships and be held accountable for its technical work. The bill outlines the need for procedures to govern participant selection and contracts. Eligible entities to participate include institutions of higher education, federally funded research centers, and nonprofit research institutions, aiming to advance U.S. space exploration capabilities.
